content.description: Three resistors are constructed in the shape of a bar, each having the same length <math alttext="L" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>L</mi></math> and the same square cross section of area <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>A</mi></math>. The bars are made of different materials and have different resistivities as follows.
content.question: In Bar <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, the resistivity has a uniform value of <math alttext="rho sub 1 equals 1.5 rho sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>ρ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>1.5</mn><msub><mi>ρ</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>, where <math alttext="rho sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>ρ</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> is a positive constant, along the length of the bar.In Bar <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, the resistivity varies along the length of the bar. The resistivity, as a function of distance <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math> from the left end of the bar, is <math alttext="rho sub 2, of x, equals rho sub 0, times open parenthesis, 1 plus the fraction x over L, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>ρ</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>ρ</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mi>x</mi><mi>L</mi></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>.In Bar <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math>, the resistivity varies along the length of the bar according to the function <math alttext="rho sub 3, of x, equals rho sub 0, times open parenthesis, 1 plus, open parenthesis, the fraction x over L, close parenthesis, squared, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>ρ</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>ρ</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mi>x</mi><mi>L</mi></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>.Which of the following claims about the resistances of the bars is correct?

choices.label: Bar <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> has a greater resistance than Bar <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>.
Bar <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> has a greater resistance than Bar <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>.
Bar <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> has a greater resistance than Bar <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math>.
Bar <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math> has a greater resistance than Bar <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>.

content.answer: Bar <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> has a greater resistance than Bar <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math>.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
